textPlain: Another chapter of the slowly-reimplementing-Vertica saga.It's becoming clear that merge trees and compaction need to be addressed next, after delete vectors brought them onstage.Vertica will actually look up the equality keys in a relevant projection if it exists, and then use the column values in the matching rows to equality-delete from the other projections; it's fairly good at avoiding table scans.

> Databricks recently spent $1 billion to acquire Neon, a startup building a serverless Postgres. Snowflake also spent about $250 million to acquire Crunchy Data, a veteran enterprise-grade Postgres provider.It's kinda funny to not mention that Databricks acquired Tabular, the Iceberg company, for a billion dollars: https://www.databricks.com/company/newsroom/press-releases/d...
Change Data Capture is hard if you fall off the happy path, and data lakes won't save you.
